SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.net

Class RmiServerImpl

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.net.RmiServerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
RmiServerInterface, Serializable, Remote
public class RmiServerImpl extends UnicastRemoteObject implements RmiServerInterface
The `RmiServerImpl` class is an implementation of the `RmiServerInterface` interface. It acts as the server-side RMI (Remote Method Invocation) implementation for handling client requests. This class provides methods for performing various actions on the server, such as dragging tiles to the bookshelf, joining or creating a game, sending messages, and more.
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

    • RmiServerImpl

      public RmiServerImpl(ServerDispatcherInterface serverDispatcherInterface, ClientInterface client) throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new `RmiServerImpl` instance with the specified server dispatcher and client interfaces.
      Parameters:
      serverDispatcherInterface - The server dispatcher interface responsible for dispatching server messages.
      client - The client interface representing the connected client.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI-related error occurs during construction.

      Specified by:
      dragTilesToBookShelf in interface RmiServerInterface
      Parameters:
      chosenTiles - The coordinates of the chosen tiles to drag.
      chosenColumn - The column index of the bookshelf where the tiles will be dragged.

    • nop

      public void nop() throws RemoteException
      Sends a "nop" (no operation) message to the server. This is used to keep the connection alive without performing any specific action.
      Specified by:
      nop in interface RmiServerInterface
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If an RMI-related error occurs during the method invocation.
